content:
Hello all! This is the thread of discussion for the talk of Daniel Cicala, "Rewriting Structured Cospans".
Date and time: Tuesday July 7, 21:35 UTC.
Zoom meeting: https://mit.zoom.us/j/7055345747
YouTube live stream: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5Rs_7ZCH1Wc&list=PLCOXjXDLt3pZDHGYOIqtg1m1lLOURjl1Q

I think the talks at the end of the day get less comments because everyone is exhausted, but thanks for a really interesting talk! It's great to have a general formalism for rewriting that covers lots of useful open systems. For my own benefit and others', the relevant paper looks to be arXiv:2001.09029 and the PhD thesis is arXiv:1906.05443. If there any other resources I should know about, please tell me.

Thanks for the interesting talk! In trying to hammer my intuition of string rewriting onto graph rewriting, I wonder if somehow characterizing the grammar/language may give us some idea about the causal structure of the network it's rewriting/generating?
